title: SIGABRT on g++ with v2.0.0-develop.3. Version v1.10.0 works ok.
body:
## Description
I recently replaced Catch v1.10.0 with v2.0.0-develop.3.
Everything works correctly on Windows with Visual Studio 2017.

When I compile with:
"g++ (Ubuntu 5.4.0-6ubuntu1~16.04.4) 5.4.0 20160609"
I receive SIGABRT during one of the tests.

All tests are executed in the same way. I load some data from file, process it during two different algorithms that are expected to give the same result and finally I just compare two results.

Testing code is available here:
https://github.com/mgr-inz-rafal/tubac/blob/19ad88854278e2e27ab0bfe9ceb9c7cb78ed06ca/tests/src/tests.cpp#L308

### Steps to reproduce
Actually, I just run the tests with 
CHECK(result.first == result.second)
where result is defined as:
std::pair<std::string, std::string> result;

### Extra information
In the "old" version I have proper PASSED:
```
/home/prezes/Git/tubac/tests/src/tests.cpp:333: 
PASSED:
  CHECK( result.first == result.second )
with expansion:
  "122
  12
  
  72"
  ==
  "122
  12
  
  72"
with messages:
  10 PRINT 1;2;
  20 PRINT 2
  30 PRINT 1;
  40 PRINT 2
  50 PRINT
  60 PRINT 7;2
  suites/print/semicolon.txt

```

In new version I have the following output:
```
/home/prezes/Git/tubac/tests/src/tests.cpp:333: 
PASSED:
  CHECK( result.first == result.second )
with expansion:
  "122
tubac_tests: /home/prezes/Git/tubac/tests/src/../../external/catch/catch.hpp:3723: std::__cxx11::string Catch::clara::TextFlow::Column::iterator::operator*() const: Assertion `m_pos < m_end' failed.
  12/home/prezes/Git/tubac/tests/src/tests.cpp:322: FAILED:
  {Unknown expression after the reported line}
due to a fatal error condition:
  10 PRINT 1;2;
  20 PRINT 2
  30 PRINT 1;
  40 PRINT 2
  50 PRINT
  60 PRINT 7;2
  suites/print/semicolon.txt
  SIGABRT - Abort (abnormal termination) signal

```
